comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: A-6E 155669 in gull gray and white with radome overspray. Darker gray glareshield paint over nose. Colorful sword marking of VA-145 ‘Swordsmen’ on tail with green band across top. Modex code 505 on side of nose in black with last two digits '05' in white on upper tail. Code NE of Carrier Air Wing Two (CVW-2) over squadron emblem. VA-145 aft of national insignia and USS RANGER over word NAVY. Fuel tank on outer wing tank decorated with green striping. Emblem aft of cockpit akin to 'Spirit of 76' special United States of America Bicentennial celebration markings. Nothing like the VA-145 insignia: bluejacket.com/usn/insignia/av/va-vd/va145_insig.jpg The original picture may date from 1976. Use of ‘flickr’ 'Actions', 'View All sizes' and 'Original' facilities plus keyboard ‘Ctrl’ with + (plus sign)or mouse wheel to increase size allows identification of details. The image has fair definition. This 'GO!NAVY' internet webpage records the 1976 deployment of VA-145: www.gonavy.jp/CVW-NEf.html This was aboard CV-61 USS RANGER from January 30 to September 7, 1976 for Western Pacific, Indian Ocean voyage. Unfortunately there are as yet no published details matching airframe serial numbers to squadrons to allow positive identification. A 1969-1970 record for A-6A 155669: www.gonavy.jp/CVW14-NK1969.html with CVW-14 (code NK) deployed on CVA-64 USS CONSTELLATION between August 11, 1969 & May 8, 1970 (Vietnam War) A-6A 155669 is recorded with VA-85 'Black Falcons' as Modex 507. A 1981-1982 record for A-6E 155669: www.gonavy.jp/CVW9-NG1981.html A-6E 155669 is recorded with VA-165 ‘Boomers’ as Modex 506 when part of CVW-9 (code NG) aboard CV-64 USS CONSTELLATION from October 20, 1981 to May 23, 1982 (WestPac, Indian Ocean deployment) A 1993 record for A-6E 155669: www.gonavy.jp/CVW8-AJ1993.html This was with CVW-8 (code AJ) from March 11 to September 8, 1993 embarked on CVN-71 USS THEODORE ROOSEVELT for an Atlantic Ocean & Mediterranean Sea patrol. A-6E 155669 was part of VA-36 'Roadrunners' as Modex 512. A 1995 sighting report for A-6E 155669 at Norfolk Naval Air Depot, Virginia: www.scramble.nl/showreports.htm (Click on 'North America' on left then within the list ‘United States of America’, on ‘Norfolk (VA)’ then on ‘1995’ to view – scroll down to entry) NAS Norfolk (VA), 42nd International Azelea Festival Air Show. 29 April 1995. Norfolk Naval Air Depot Storage: A-6E : 155669/ AD-517 The entry is interpreted that A-6E 155669 was seen marked with tail code AD of VA-42 ‘Thunderbolts’, marked Modex 517, and had been part of the US East coast based Fleet Requirements Squadron that trained Intruder aviators and maintainers, after being placed in store before eventual decision on disposal. There's no known record of it being retired to AMARC storage in Arizona. A picture dated up to 1992 of A-6E 155669 with VA-42 'Green Pawns' as Modex 551 in overall gray may be found here: italy-spotterstolit.forumfree.it/?t=44376245&st=90 img27.imageshack.us/i/155669a6eva42ad.jpg/ (Use slider on right to scroll down one third of page to view first version) In 1992, the squadron’s Green Pawn insignia was officially changed from the pawn as used in the game of chess to the mailed fist and lighting bolt previously worn by VA-176 'Thunderbolts'. It’s not yet known what or when was the final fate of A-6A/E 155669. Internet accessible records for A-6A 155669 are as yet very sparse. Further info that may reveal much more on the service history of A-6A/E 155669 might be available by use of the US Freedom of Information Act by ANY human being. foia.navy.mil/OnlineFoiaRequestForm2.asp (As GO!NAVY' website info is gathered on a purely voluntary basis and may be fragmentary or incomplete, it’s extremely fortunate when records matching individual airframe serial numbers to units are available. For which recognition and appreciation of Takafumi Hiroe, citizen of Japan and naval air historian for all ‘GO!NAVY’ references is deserved)

comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Similar commercially available picture of an A-6E Intruder from VA-145 in same markings wearing 'Spirit of 76' motif aft of cockpit: www.cloud9photography.us/Military-Aviation-10/Grumman-A-6... BICEN-A-6 00003 Grumman A-6 Intruder USN VA-145 Oct 1978 by Peter J Mancus
